had to type in my hours for my last 2 and a half weeks in Oshkosh to email, i was there 2 weeks before that too

the two full weeks in there add up to a 97.5 hour week and a 94.5 hour week

good times at EAA, chilled the whole week while enjoying the air show all day

never drank so much sparks

got a sweet waste management hat and matching shirt from drunk man

did donuts in our pick up, fork lift, and boom lift

tipped over a port-a-john

played air hockey

heard stories about how clearspan expert jeff canter impaled a man with a stake

enjoyed an evening at bean snappers

saw harrison ford give a weak ass speech due to the fact that he was drunk and/or high

talked to a research scientist from nasa's langley research center

got a disordely conduct ticket for driving our gator too crazy

got the flower girl's number

 

...no more work

 

"taker easy, take her twice if she's easy, and if she's that easy tell my ex-wife i said hi"

so yeah an i come back from oshkosh after working 73 hrs this week and i have to go back up in an hour with some mexicans that are picking me up at my house.  4 of us are gonna be up there for a week during the EAA festival driving around looking to see if tents are in good condition, plus we drink (it's company policy).  the girls that tend to the flowers are hot, ima try to get their numbers and what not...

if you guys wanna come up to it we can hang out while i'm working and drink, you can even spend the night in our trailer, there's plenty of beds, like 14 and theres only 3 people staying there cause the other guy lives in oshkosh.  the event starts monday till the 31st i think.  call me

...i dare you to look that shit up bitch

what is up? it shows that i dont update this thing much but i'm trying you slut. so this week and the next i will be in Oshkosh setting up for the EAA plane show. we set up like 300 tents which is lame. i'll prolly be up there with a bunch of mexicans too, who lack the ability to speak english. it should be a kicking ill time. i want to go to the actual event this year becasue it seems like it would be interesting with all the shit they have. so if anyone would be interested in goin get in contact with me, otherwise just feign interest. this weekend should be fun though since i'm goin to chicago for the intonation music festival (www.intonationmusicfest.com) with nate, greg, and kelly. maybe even nas who is gonna be in milwaukee friday night, but we'll see. i have yet to order the tickets but i'll soon get on that, along with your mom. what am i reading you ask? well, its a book called The Right Stuff, by Tom Wolfe. my bro got it for my b-day, it's about the first astronauts and everything they had to go through. conveniently it's appropriate for me, it seems solid. i must go since shamoon is coming over to "chill poolside", that's code for dirty hot sex poolside, i think, but in any case i gotta be prepared. does anyone actually read this?

Sarang and I cooked some sweet ass brats tonight in our dorm kitchen.  Such a good change from crappy ass dorm food.

tip: smoke before you drink

I decided to start posting on here again since i'm bored and need something to do, and maybe some people want to hear about some shiznat.

Most of you know that I could somewhat c-walk.  So I joined this site where people upload videos their walkin.  They have this special access part of the site where all the really crazy good people post their shit and you can download tons of albums and other stuff.  But to get into it you need to post videos and get voted in.  So i decided to upload some videos and see how I compared to this people.  They said I had potential and I got better and finally was voted in.  Now, you would think all these people are like internet nerds trying to be cool or something like that, but first off they are all amazing at c-walkin.  So i've posted on the site for a while and some of these people are actually crips, like one was talking about how he was about to "tryout" for them.  This other guy talked about how he was leaving the site for a while because he's friend was shot.  All these people talk about this hardcore shit i'm just like, yup i'm white.

I hate people who judge something before they even understand what it is.  It might be funny if you are joking around about hating something, but when you just keep complaining I fucking hate you.

Just got back from upper michigan with my dad.  We went camping on the ole lake superior.  It was some nice father and son bonding with some jack and coke as well.

So i had surgery last friday, it went well.  The surgery was so they could take out the plate and screws in my arm from when I broke my elbow last August.  The laughing gas they used was freaking awesome, I was totally tripping out.  The doctors left part of a screw they had busted off in my elbow but its all good.

Joey's graduation party was the place to be last night.  His family really knows how to party.  We did some scenic boating and a little bocce as well.  Since Joey didn't have to work the next day we decided to stay over night.  We had loads of fun.  Joey got real funked up.  It was awesome.
So I go into work today packed and ready for a week up in Oshkosh and they say that i'm not going up.  I only have to work 3 days this week.  Fuck yeah.

Monday through Wednesday I was up in Oshkosh working at the fly-in.  Same old same old there.  Thursday I worked half a day then my parents picked me up so we could drive up north for the Penegor Family Reunion, which takes place every 5 years.  I wasn't at the last one because I was in Australia, so I hardly new anyone.  There were a bunch of cousins my age that I hung out with which was pretty cool.  We stayed in Ontanagon, the town my dad grew up in, at his old house.  Thursday night I did nothing after we arrived, except view Unforgiven, one of the top westerns out there.  Friday was the big ass golf outing with like 100 people.  It was a scramble.  We ended up 3 under and there was a tie for first at 5 under.  They had to go to extra holes to determine the winner.  After that I went to a cottage down the street that some of my cousins were staying at, they had a keg...I got smashed, and I smoked a bowl with some of my cousins.  The next day my brother Joel, his wife Carolyn, and I took our boat out on the river and then out into lake Superior.  It was nice and relaxing.  Later that day was the big ass dinner.  I had the prime rib.  It was exquisite minus the fact most of it was fat.  At dinner people told stories of family and such.  After dinner my parents left because I was the designated driver for my bro and his wife because our house was an hour drive from where dinner was.  We went out to this bar where most of the rest of the family was.  I got kicked out since i'm not 21 and don't have a fake.  We couldn't really do anything else since I was the dd for them, so we walked back the the car and the battery was dead.  Apparemtly my bro came out to get his cigs before dinner and left the keys in the ignition.  So with that we decided we were gonna just stay at the hotel the dinner was at with everyone else.  My brother and sister-in-law went back to the bar and I went up to a hotel room with a bunch of my cousins who couldn't get into the bar either.  We drank some brewskies, smoked together again, and then played some cards.  I got to bed on the floor of a hotel room at like 4:30.  It was a great family fun filled night.  The next day was the picnic and family pictures.  We had some sweet pasties and what not.  There was another keg there but I really didn't drink any.  My cousins and I played some volleyball and then we(my parents and I) had to shove off.  It was a kick ass time, I never new how much the rest of my family rocks.

http://www.fs.fed.us/r9/ottawa/fishing/lakes/penegor.htm

I have to go now, since I'm leaving for Oshkosh again tomorrow...awesome...
you will be missed mad dog maederer

Just got back from another sweet week in Oshkosh for the EAA dealie.  It was freaking hot the entire time and I now have an exquisite farmers tan.  I drank like 6 bottles of corona with my mexi friends while watching the Mexican soccer team in the copa americana.  They also introduced me to some stellar mexican rap, including Dae-p and the Dyablos.  We went to taco bell later and one of them asked me to ask this white girl for her phone number (since he doesn't speak hardly any english) which I did.  She turned out to be 16, he's like 23.  The mexis have all jumped on the bandwagon of calling me by my nickname, cunado (with a tilde on the n).  The started calling me this after they found out I have 2 sisters.  It means brother-in-law, because they act like they are gonna marry my sisters.  The EAA grounds are pretty big so we have to drive around in different Karl's party rental vehicles.  I was driving this pick-up truck and I floored it right before this small hill.  It was so sweet, I got a second or two of full on airtime.  

In other news, my new computer for college came while I was gone.  I'm pumped to set it up.

http://www.foodforthemoon.com/ninja/

real ultimate power official ninja movie

i flipped out and killed someone when i saw it

It's been a while since I have posted anything, because I have been up in Oshkosh working for karls party rental.  I got up and arrived at work at 6 on monday.  I drove the company car (Ford Windstar) up with a mexican guy named Mario, he reminds me a lot of Mario from Mario and Luigi, it's real weird.  The days went by kinda fast, I worked 7 to 6 every day except one where I worked til 7.  The nights mainly consisted of a bunch of guys goin out to eat.  One night though, it was pretty excellent because I became intoxicated from some beer with my fellow employees, one of which was my manager.  He got pretty smashed.  The tents we were setting up are for the EAA which stands for Experimental Aircraft Association.  There's a big event called Air Venture where thousands and thousands of people with planes get together thousands more come to watch.  Apparently theres tons of sweet planes.

 

The work hasn't been too bad, a lot of screwing around.  The grounds are pretty huge so we are usually driving from one end to the other tearing it up on the gravel paths doing donuts and what not.  One guy had those little 1 shot bottles of vodka and was mixing them in his orange juice while he was working.  He also snorted some coke or some shit before we went out one night and was super geeked out.  The last day he even made pot brownies.  There are guys that work for use temporarily, or a temp, and we figured one of em smoked a few bowls during lunch.  He was acting real crazy and asked me for some soda because he had cottonmouth.  He was a little bitch because he didn't do anywork and had to leave early because apparently some mechanic put oil in his window washer container.  Another guy whose one of the more important workers because of his knowledge of clearspan tents bought a whole bunch of fireworks before he got up.  He was lighting em off while we were working all the time.  He even shot this rocket thing at the site manager.  This job has its benefits for me, not only in pay.  It's good physical activity and also since there are so many non english speaking mexicans that work there I get to practice my spanish all the time.  Theres like 300 tents that have to be put up and i'm going back next week, monday to friday, to continue the project.

Last night was pretty crazy seeing Crosby, Stills, and Nash while it was pouring rain. I got my admission ticket from a sweet scalper for only $5. It rained basically non-stop from the moment we stepped off the bus to go to the show till I arrived home. I was so soaked. My Sauza kept me warm though. I just found out today that Sarang and Kenny drank last night at Joey's house. I'm so proud, but I wish I could have been there.

I thought Talib Kweli preformed well, but the show was way too short.  It was only one hour.  The other thing that pissed me off was at one point in the show Talib asked for people to come up on stage that knew how to break dance and what not, a bunch of people went up and did ok.  But then it somehow turned into all these white guys dancing real bad and flashing "gang" signs to the audience.

When we were walking thought the crowds jared found one of those little flashing lights that you'd expect to see at raves.  He would go up to people a flash it at them and make some face.  I loved how the only reaction he provoked in guys was an aggressive tone and the guy acting like he wanted to fight.  One young gentleman replied "Keep looking, ya fucking faggot!"  Wow, how classy.

Wow, Peter Frampton rocked the house.  That concert was so good I think I wet myself.  

Speaking of concerts the Beastie Boys will hopefully be touring soon.  The tour has been delayed since Mike D. had a baby.

Just found out today at work the next week I will be going up to the EAA place to put up tents.  The thing is we are gonna be staying over night monday through friday and going to be paid to sleep there.  I'm going to be bringing in the big bucks.

So last night I was laying in bed, perfectly still mind you, when all of a sudden my bed was rocked slighty back and forth.  It freaked the shit out of me, i thought someone was in my room for a second.  Today I found out it was an earthquake...earthquake? What the fuck, those aren't suppose to happen here.

In other news work was awesome like usual.  Plus I found out i'm going to be able get a volleyball net and one of those large bouncy things you used to jump around in at festivals and such from my work(Karl's) for my birthday on the 3rd of July.  Everyone had best be there.

So the last two days my parents have left me home alone, and u would think i'd do something like have at least a small party or what not.  But they decided to have my older sister and my grandma to stay over night for both days.  I guess it wasn't that bad of an idea considering the last party i had when they were gone.

I went to Best Buy the other day and bought a bunch of sweet dvds with money from graduation:

For a Few Dollars More

                                                    Reservoir Dogs
                                                 
The Magnificent Seven

                                                       Mad Max
                                                
         Zulu

                                       Once Upon a Time in the West
Lawrence of Arabia       
                    Zatoichi at Large
                                              

I would recommend them all.  The next two i want to buy are A Fistful of Dollars so i can have the complete "The Man with No Name" trilogy by Sergio Leone and then Mad Max 2: The Road Warrior.  Best Buy didn't have them, those bastards.
i hate people who bitch if something doesn't go exactly the way they want it to

Haven't had much free time lately, with work and all (13 hour day today),

just got back from New York as well, and it was loads of fun.  I went with my parents to see my sister whose living there now.  My sister and I also went to the Dysfunctional Family Picnic concert, it was amazing...the Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Brand New, Cypress Hill, The Darkness, The Beastie Boys, and the Strokes.  The Beasie boys were awesome, and after their set, one of the announcers (the black lady from the howard stern show) said that they had a special guest for us.  This guy came out with his hat real low and no one knew who it was.  The crowd went wild when he raised his head and everyone realized it was Jay-Z.

it was sweet

Kickass,

My flight to new york was canceled.  So i'm here for the night and have to get up at 3:30 in the morning to get on the next flight in.  Apparently there are thunder storms in NY and they can't land?

In other news, i'm remaking the BC Pictures site because I just bought the domain bcpictures04.com, it should be up soon.  After that I will be able to add tons of pictures, never go over the bandwidth limit, and have no ads pop up.

Degree: Engineering Mechanics and Astronautics

aka a rocket scientist

So, after orientation at madison I decided that I will join the crew team, even though I have never done it before.  Along with that I plan to join many clubs to keep busy, such as the Eagle Claw Kung Fu club. 

Right when I got home from orientation I went out and purchased the new Beastie Boys album. It rocks so hard. Even though I had already had it for like 2 weeks before. Leaving for New York in 5 hours and i'm pumped as hell to see the Beastie Boys.

Kenny's grad party was very kickin' today.  Diane and James really know how to throw it down, even if it means mistaking KJ for Sarang and Jenna for Sandra.  Hey, everything in life comes at a cost.  All his uncles couldn't sit still, because they had to keep an eye on the Nascar race that was going on during the party.  What a sacrifice, going to a graduation party instead of watching Matt Kenseth

SOAR tomorrow, heard it was boring as shit...can't wait...

Today was pretty solid, I worked from 7 to 430. Most of the time I was packed with some mexicans in a truck driving to madison and back. We put up a 100 by 40 foot tent for these guys who worked for some beer distribution company that was handing out steel reserve. Tonight I polished off my last bottle of Saki...I was sad...but not too sad since it's not that great. Willkommen and I invened a new drink though, Saki mixed with everclear called...the Nagasaki! Lots of PTC at the SJV fair, good times

Just got home from a sweet 12 hour shift at Karl's Party Rental where I work.  I was scheduled from 8-4 but somehow got dragged into 4 more hours.  It was good though, this lady forked over $100 to me and this guy Israel for putting up two tents that she was supposed to for this church event.  Plus all the other stops we had to make were real simple.  

We had some interesting conversations about different things, like how his brother sometimes hits his girlfriend and another time when the girl was mad at his brother so she told her mom that she gives him head all the time.  Seems like a nice family to me.  

He also told me this story of how about 7 guys worked at Karl's for about a week or two and then they all just didn't show up one day.  Apparently they just worked to make enough money to go to a Phish concert and when someone called them to find out what happened, they basically said that they were rich and didn't need to work.

And another time this guy took a truck to set up a bunch of tents or drop some shit off.  He told the people they had to pay cash and then just booked it out of town.

Izzy's 100% mexican, but I was lucky since he's the only one there that speaks fluent english
